intro: Manisuris divergens var. hirsuta, commonly known as the hairy manisuris, is a perennial herbaceous plant native to specific regions of Southeast Asia. It is characterized by its hairy, glandular leaves that give it a distinctive textured appearance. The plant produces small, inconspicuous flowers that are typically greenish-white in color. It thrives in moist, shaded environments and is often found in forest understories. Its botanical features make it an interesting subject for ecological and taxonomic studies.
